sub_title: Administrative Assistant - Trial Chamber (Judiciary) at International Criminal Court
summary: Committed team player with strong organizational, communication and supervisory skills. Over twenty-four years of wide ranging experience in international legal organizations. Eager to learn and develop new areas of expertise in field of international justice administration.

company.name: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)

profile_positions.company: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)
profile_positions.description: Provided support across full spectrum of HR Staff Administration to IRMCT staff in multiple locations of the organization (The Netherlands, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Tanzania and Rwanda); Manage SAP ERP ("Umoja") and off-line workflows in the administration of contracts, salaries, dependency, international mobility, travel, social security and time management; Provided tailored HR advice to staff regarding UN policies, rules and regulations.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Assistant - Staff Administration (Registry, HR Section)

profile_positions.company: United Nations International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (IRMCT)
profile_positions.description:
•	Processed applications for vacancies.
•	Maintained Job opening files and tracked status of vacancy announcements.
•	Assisted in evaluation and screening of applications of candidates. 
•	Arranged competency based interviews and testing of candidates. 
•	Advised candidates on rules and procedures related to recruitment.
•	Maintained automated databases containing HR related statistics and prepared periodic reports.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Assistant - Recruitment (Registry, HR Section)

profile_positions.description:
Case management support:
•	Coordinated and tracked cases, information, workflows and legal service requests.
•	Operated paper and electronic information management systems (SharePoint), for storing of case and legal reference files.
•	Liaised with ICC Appeals Board / Disciplinary Advisory Board and ILO Administrative Tribunal in handling staff appeals and in order to ensure timely follow-up to legal submissions and correspondence.

General administrative, human resources and financial/budgetary support:
•	Responsible for team calendar/schedules, mail handling, submission of translation requests, and office space arrangements. 
•	Contributed to establishing and operationalizing the Registry Legal Network, including by organizing meetings, training sessions and guest lectures, and updating the RLN SharePoint site. 
•	Acted as RLO’s focal point for HR related matters: attendance, staff training and recruitment. 
•	Liaised with HR and Budget Sections regarding funding for new GTA / STA positions and consultants. 
•	Handled various budgetary and financial procedures, including preparing the Section’s Proposed Programme Budget using the newly created BPC software; monitoring budget expenditure and transfer of funds in SAP; creating and/or overseeing purchase requisitions, purchase orders, service entry sheets, travel requests and travel expense reports in SAP.

Personal assistance to Chief, Registry Legal Office:
•	Managed work calendar; screened phone calls and visitors; arranged and prepared documentation for scheduled meetings; took minutes of meetings and drafted follow-up action; drafted and finalized various types of correspondence for signature; coordinated travel arrangements and reimbursement of expenses; ensured proper handling of confidential documentation and related information.
profile_positions.title: Administrative/Legal Assistant (Registry, Legal Office)

company.name: United Nations Mechanism for International Criminal Tribunals (UN-MICT)

profile_positions.company: United Nations Mechanism for International Criminal Tribunals (UN-MICT)
profile_positions.description:
- Supervised work of DU’s Support Staff members (Administration, Language and IT), including prioritization, assignment and review of completed tasks and conduct of yearly performance appraisals. 
- Reviewed procedures, designing and implementing Standard Operating Procedures aimed at improved functioning of DU’s administration.
- Administered HR recruitment process for new Support Staff positions, including developing tests, participating in Competency Based Interviews and drafting CBI reports.
- Processed medical experts and travel in SAP/Umoja by way of registering vendors, creating fund commitments and service entry sheets, raising travel requests and expense reports. 
- Monitored budget, expenditure and availability of funds.
- Supported work of Legal Coordinator for Detention Matters and Immediate Office of the Registrar in regard to contact with external parties, document distribution, translation and interpretation requests, visit requests, engagement of consultants and medical experts, etc.
- Acted as the DU's Focal Point for transition to SAP/Umoja, records archiving, staff training and attendance.
profile_positions.title: Senior Administrative Assistant (Registry, UN Detention Unit)

profile_positions.description:
As Legal Assistant in the Appeal Division:
- Assisted Case Manager and Legal Team in all phases of Appeal process. 
- Supported analysis of evidence prior to Appeal hearings and closing arguments. Attended hearings and assisted members of Appeal Team during presentation of evidence in court. 

As Acting Case Manager in Trial Division:
- Reviewed evidentiary material admitted in the case to ensure correctness.
- Updated and prepared case related hard-copy and electronic files for hand-over to the Appeal Division.
profile_positions.title: Legal Assistant (Office of the Prosecutor, Appeals Division)

profile_positions.description:
- Assisted in identification and organization of in-house and open-source documentary, audio and video material relevant to the Prosecution Case. 
- Facilitated disclosure process by reviewing evidentiary materials and identifying inclulpatory and exculpatory evidence (documentary, photographic, audio and video).
- Produced summaries of evidence, reports and analytical charts on specific topics as required by the Criminal Analysts. 
- Conducted searches in evidence databases (Case Map, E-Court, Live Note) and created reports as required by Prosecution Team.
profile_positions.title: Cross-training in Criminal Intelligence Analysis (Office of the Prosecutor, Trial Division)

profile_positions.location: UN International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia (UNICTY)
profile_positions.description:
As Legal Assistant in four multi accused cases before the ICTY:

- Conducted searches based on key word criteria using data mining software ZyFind and dtSearch.
- Assisted disclosure process by reviewing evidentiary materials and identifying inclulpatory and exculpatory evidence (documentary, photographic, audio and video).
- Prepared material for hard-copy or electronic disclosure, while ensuring that witness protection measures are in place and sensitive documents redacted.
- Maintained and updated electronic and physical systems for organization of all case-related information to be retrieved by members of Trial team.
- Prepared and finalized exhibits for display in court, including creation of exhibits using scanning equipment, electronic mapping and graphic systems.

In the absence of Case Manager:
- Ensured accurate processing of Prosecution filings and timely circulation of filings from all parties to Prosecution team.  
- Facilitated full and proper use of electronic tools during trial, including Casemap, Sanction, E-Court and LiveNote.
- Acted as representative of Trial Team in dealing with the Registry, Chambers and Defence.
profile_positions.title: Legal Assistant (Office of the Prosecutor, Trial Division)

profile_positions.description:
- Managed transition from decentralized translation submission, tracking, and return process to a centralized process via the Translation Tracking System (TTS).
- Performed searches for possible duplicate translations by means of metadata (using the exact or partial word/phrase and boolean search types), by means of various search applications (dtSearch, ZyFind, Jigsaw, Translation Request Application, Electronic Disclosure Suite), recording  the findings accurately in Translation Tracking System.
- Ensured smooth and timely flow of translation requests from Chambers, Registry, Defense and Office of the Prosecutor, with a view to ensuring the Tribunal’s simultaneous conduct of six trials.
profile_positions.title: Document Management Assistant (Registry, Office of Document Management)

profile_positions.description:
- Maintained Judge's calendar, arranged meetings/appointments and received visitors.  
- Handled Judge’s work related and private correspondences and ensured timely follow-up.
- Made arrangements for Judge’s official travel and other tasks of personal nature. 
- Organized and maintained electronic and hard-copy collection of working documents for over 20 ICTY and ICTR Appeal cases.  
- Ensured timely distribution of all incoming and outgoing filings and other correspondences.
- Assisted with drafting and formatting of memoranda, decisions, orders, speeches, lectures and various other forms of written correspondence. 
- Assisted with preparation of documents and briefing materials for meetings, took notes during meetings and prepared minutes with follow-up action points.
- Conducted research on topics relevant to Judge’s official work and external lectures.
profile_positions.title: Judge's Assistant (Appeals Chamber)

profile_positions.description:
As Trial Support Clerk:
- Maintained and updated electronic and physical systems for organization of all case-related information to be retrieved by members of Trial Team.
- Prepared materials for hard-copy or electronic disclosure, while ensuring that witness protection measures are in place and sensitive documents redacted. 
- Assembled exhibits and organized daily presentation of evidence in court. 

As Acting Case Manager:
- Responsible for accurate processing of Prosecution filings and timely circulation of filings from all parties to Prosecution team.  
- Conducted searches for information relating to potential witnesses, exculpatory evidence, and any materials that may support Prosecution case. 
- Coordinated all case-related tasks between team lawyers and investigators.
- Acted as representative of the Trial Team in communication with the Registry, Chambers and Defence.
- In accordance with ICTY Rule 11bis, prepared case related materials for transfer to the War Crimes Court in Bosnia.
profile_positions.title: Trial Support Clerk (Office of the Prosecutor, Trial Divison)

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinated receipt, prioritization and distribution of translation requests. 
- Managed and updated English Translation Unit databases used to keep track of translation requests and finalized translations.
- Organized production schedule according to case priorities and changing influx of translation requests. 
- Incorporated final revisions, formatted translations according to English Translation Unit guidelines and prepared them for electronic dispatch to requesting parties.
- Maintained safeguards ensuring confidentiality of translation requests. 
- Communicated daily with staff in various Sections of ICTY to ensure timely delivery of finalized translations.
profile_positions.title: Translation Coordinator (Registry, Conference and Language Services Section)

profile_positions.description:
- Assisted members of investigation and military analysis teams in selection of evidentiary material relevant to the case.
- Provided sight and written summary translation (Bosnian/Croatian/Serbian to English) of open source and confidential military documents. 
- Transcribed audio/video material in BCS and English. 
- Redacted sensitive BCS documents prior to disclosure. 
- Interpreted during witness interviews in the field and during preparation of witnesses for court testimony.
profile_positions.title: Language/Analysis Assistant (Office of the Prosecutor, Military Analysis Unit)
